intro: Arenga engleri, commonly known as the giant palm or arenga palm, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers followed by edible fruits that are used in traditional medicine and as a source of starch. Its fibrous leaves are also utilized in basket weaving and thatching. Arenga engleri thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests.
